conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the system of two sliders A and B to solve for the magnitude of the external force F.
Two sliders A and B are on an inclined plane with angle 37 degrees, connected by a rope, with a force F applied to slider B.
Identify the forces acting on each slider.
Forces on Slider A: gravitational force mg, normal force N_A, frictional force f_A, tension T.
Forces on Slider B: gravitational force mg, normal force N_B, frictional force f_B, tension T, external force F.
Resolve the forces into components parallel and perpendicular to the incline.
Parallel component of gravity for Slider A is 0.6mg.
Perpendicular component of gravity for Slider A is 0.8mg.
Normal force N_A for Slider A is 0.8mg.
Frictional force f_A for Slider A is 0.4mg.
Parallel component of gravity for Slider B is 0.6mg.
Perpendicular component of gravity for Slider B is 0.8mg.
Normal force N_B for Slider B is 0.8mg.
Frictional force f_B for Slider B is 0.4mg.
Set up the equations of motion since the sliders are on the verge of not sliding upwards.
Equation of motion for Slider A: T - 0.6mg - 0.4mg = 0, thus T = 1.0mg.
Resolve external force F for Slider B into components: parallel 0.8F, perpendicular 0.6F.
New normal force N_B' for Slider B is 0.8mg + 0.6F.
New frictional force f_B' for Slider B is 0.4mg + 0.3F.
Equation of motion for Slider B: 0.8F - T - 0.6mg - 0.4mg - 0.3F = 0, leading to 0.5F = 1.0mg.
Solve for F: F = 2mg.
